page.title: 08TATLINGBURY FARM IN CAPEL
page.content: TATLINGBURY COVERS 380 ACRES. CROPS GROWN CONSIST OF{HOPS}-62 ACRES IN 1984 & 55 THIS YEAR,{WHEAT}- 157, {BARLEY}- 47,{APPLES}- 41 (5 SPARTAN,10 DISCOVERY & 26 BRAMLEY) & 12 ACRES OF {GRASSLAND.}670 TONS OF GRAIN IS HARVESTED BEFORE HOPPICKING WHICH PRODUCES 3 TONS OF HOPS PER ACRE - 15 ACRES OF{YEOMAN}AND 40 ACRES OF{TARGET WHICH YIELD A{HIGH ALPHA CONTENT PREFERRED BY BREWERS. PROTECTIVE APPLE SPRAYING BEGINS IN APRIL. A NEW ULTRA LOW VOLUME SPRAY IS VERY ECONOMIC, USING ONLY 5 GALLONS PER ACRE. GOOD STORAGE CONDITIONS ARE VITAL. 5 ACRES OF CHERRIES MAY BE PLANTED IN 1986. TATLINGBURY, PART OF THE HADLOW ESTATE HAS BEEN FARMED FOR 700 YEARS. THE PEMBLES WERE TENANTS FOR 170 YEARS UNTIL MR. HODGES CAME IN 1960. WORKERS INCLUDE 5 FULL TIME, 20 FEMALE HOP TRAINERS & 45 -50 SEASONAL PICKERS.
